page.title: 15Wild life 1.
page.content: This area is{rich}in all kinds of{wild {life.}Most common{trees}grow here,both evergreen and deciduous.Elm has always been rare,and Dutch elm disease has made it rarer. There are only a few chestnuts.Amongst the less usual trees and bushes are the alder,found especially by streams, bird cherry, blackthorn,and wayfarer bush. There are wild{flowers}in abundance.The rarest of these are the butterfly orchid,bulbous saxifrage, broomrape, angelica, and the burnet rose. Among the{animals,}we find the red squirrel,(no grey ones yet,) roe deer, badger,fox,rabbit,hare,stoat,weasel, mole,field mouse,water vole,shrew,bat, and, unfortunately, the mink. {Reptiles}found are adders and slow worms,{amphibians}frogs and toads.
